item.title: Ava's accumulator - Project Insanity
item.dc:creator: @Int_Bauk Int Bauk
item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:18, topic:509177”][quote author=Int Bauk link=topic=627420.msg4266008#msg4266008 date=1364064717]
because that’s not very OOP at all. i would just use an enum (depending on how many items are received w/e).
[/quote]
why would you use an enum?

or we can use data encapsulation and create a static array of items, which would still be following oop concepts

so i could store numerous amount(s) of data sets, as well as strings.

item.title: Ava's accumulator - Project Insanity
item.dc:creator: @Int_Bauk Int Bauk
item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:16, topic:509177”][quote author=Fridder link=topic=627420.msg4263707#msg4263707 date=1363726635]
Ava’s accumulator also gets various metal items, such as iron nails and iron bars. Maybe you should make a list of random messages corresponding with the item IDs (set off randomly, of course).

The generation rate is about one steel arrow, steel knife, or steel dart every 180 seconds.
…
If the player’s inventory is full, the attracted item will be dropped at their feet.

[/quote]
Why do that? Couldn’t you just do
[PI] c.sendMessage(“Your ava’s accumulator has binded” +avaItem[]+ " to your inventory.");
String[] avaItem = new String[3];
avaItem[0] = “something”;
etc…
and have that based on the item…[/quote]

because that’s not very OOP at all. i would just use an enum (depending on how many items are received w/e).

Read full topic

item.title: Ava's accumulator - Project Insanity
item.dc:creator: @Int_Bauk Int Bauk
item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

[quote=“relexlawl, post:2, topic:509177”]Having this event running the whole time a player is logged in is dumb…

You should start the event when a player equips an item (and you check it’s ava’s accumulator) and you should end it when they don’t have it on.

[code] private static final String ACCUMULATOR_MESSAGE = “Your ava’s accumulator has binded two steel arrows to your inventory.”;

public static void startAccumulatorEffect(Client c) {
	CycleEventHandler.getSingleton().addEvent(c, new CycleEvent() {
		@Override
		public void execute(CycleEventContainer container) {
			if(c.wearId == 10499) {
				c.getItems().addItem(886, 2);
				c.sendMessage(ACCUMULATOR_MESSAGE);
			} else {
				stop();
			}
		}
		@Override
		public void stop() {
		}
	}, 500);
}[/code][/quote]

shit, forgot that LOL. but yeah, you are right.

at first i was going to do that but there were various ways i tried causing null pointers, so i just gave up and did it the lazy shitty way. oh wells

Read full topic

item.title: Ava's accumulator - Project Insanity
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

It gets added to your worn slots, if it’s full it gets added to your invin. People will most likely get annoyed at this ingame and if it’s a rs remake I’m sure it’s not done anything like this. Nice though none the less but I don’t think it’s a positive contribution.

Read full topic

item.title: Ava's accumulator - Project Insanity
item.dc:creator: @relexlawl relexlawl
item.description:
@relexlawl wrote:

Having this event running the whole time a player is logged in is dumb…

You should start the event when a player equips an item (and you check it’s ava’s accumulator) and you should end it when they don’t have it on.

[code] private static final String ACCUMULATOR_MESSAGE = “Your ava’s accumulator has binded two steel arrows to your inventory.”;

public static void startAccumulatorEffect(Client c) {
	CycleEventHandler.getSingleton().addEvent(c, new CycleEvent() {
		@Override
		public void execute(CycleEventContainer container) {
			if(c.wearId == 10499) {
				c.getItems().addItem(886, 2);
				c.sendMessage(ACCUMULATOR_MESSAGE);
			} else {
				stop();
			}
		}
		@Override
		public void stop() {
		}
	}, 500);
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Ava's accumulator - Project Insanity
item.dc:creator: @Int_Bauk Int Bauk
item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

add this in the wear item packet:

[code] final String ACCUMULATOR_MESSAGE = “Your ava’s accumulator has binded two steel arrows to your inventory.”;
CycleEventHandler.getSingleton().addEvent(c, new CycleEvent() {
@Override
public void execute(CycleEventContainer container) {
if(c.wearId == 10499) {
c.getItems().addItem(886, 2);
c.sendMessage(ACCUMULATOR_MESSAGE);
} else {
stop();
}
@Override
public void stop() {

		}
	}, 500);
}[/code]

every 500 seconds or whatever it is (don’t know the exact conversion), 2 steel arrows will be added to your inventory.

Read full topic
